incidentsData.title: 7 killed, 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on an aid convoy and waiting civilians near the Nabulsi Roundabout in Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 12 killed, 50 wounded
incidentsData.description: Shortly after a World Food Programme convoy delivered aid to Gaza City for the first time in several weeks, Israeli quadcopter drones and tanks fired on civilians collecting aid. Sources vary on the number of casualties, from dozens killed to over 50 killed and dozens wounded.
incidentsData.sources:
Wafa
Middle East Eye
Euro-Med Monitor

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid on al-Rashid Street in Gaza City. Reports on the number of killed and wounded vary from unknown to as many as five killed.

incidentsData.title: 4 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid on al-Rashid Street in Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 6 killed, 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Artillery fire hits people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City. Initial casualty reports said two or three killed and "several" or more than 10 wounded. The number killed was later reported as six. We recorded six killed and three wounded because we couldn't verify the report of more than 10 wounded.

incidentsData.title: 20 killed, 150 wounded
incidentsData.description: At least 20 civilians killed and more than 150 injured after Israeli forces fired on crowds waiting for aid trucks near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City. The Israeli military opened an investigation.
incidentsData.sources:
OCHA
ACLED
Palestinian Centre for Human Rights
AP
Reuters
Al Jazeera

incidentsData.title: International Court of Justice provisional measures order
incidentsData.description: The ICJ orders Israel to "take all measures within its power to prevent" genocide in Gaza, and to "take immediate and effective measures" to enable the delivery of humanitarian aid. The order is part of the case brought by South Africa accusing Israel of committing genocide in Gaza.

incidentsData.title: 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City. Later reports say three people killed, but it is unclear if they are referring to the same incident. Sources mention "casualties". We recorded two wounded based on sources and video evidence.

incidentsData.title: 50 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City. Reports say that several are wounded. We recorded three wounded.

incidentsData.title: 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli tanks fired on people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City. Sources report "a number" of people killed or wounded and many casualties. We recorded two wounded.

incidentsData.title: 13 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: An Israeli airstrike hit people filling water jugs in Gaza City, killing at least 13 and wounding others.

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 6 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City. Sources report various casualty counts, from one to five killed and an unknown number to six wounded.

incidentsData.title: 8 killed

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people waiting for aid trucks in Khan Younis. Sources report two killed and a number wounded. We recorded "a number" as two.

incidentsData.title: No casualties reported
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City. No casualties were reported.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid near the Nabulsi Roundabout in Gaza City. Sources report one killed and others wounded. We recorded two wounded.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 10 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid near the Nabulsi Roundabout in Gaza City. Reported number of wounded ranged from "many" to at least 10. We recorded 10.

incidentsData.title: 5 killed, 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli quadcopters shot people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City. Sources report five killed and several wounded.

incidentsData.title: 2 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people waiting for aid west of Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 22 killed, 80 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli soldiers and tanks opened fire on a crowd of people waiting for aid near the Nabulsi roundabout at the same time as displaced people were moving south in the same area. Sources reported between 7 and 28 killed and between dozens and 80 people wounded. We recorded 22 killed and 80 wounded.

incidentsData.title: 10 killed, 15 wounded
incidentsData.description: In two separate incidents, Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid near the Nabulsi Roundabout. Sources do not include a breakdown of casualties for each incident. A total of at least 10 people are killed and 15 wounded in both incidents.
incidentsData.sources:
OCHA

Al Jazeera
Euro-Med Monitor
Euro-Med Monitor

incidentsData.title: 4 killed, 24 wounded

incidentsData.title: International Court of Justice second provisional measure order
incidentsData.description: The International Court of Justice issued a second provisional measure order in the case brought by South Africa accusing Israel of committing genocide in Gaza. In addition to the measures ordered in January, the court called on Israel to "take all necessary and effective measures to ensure, without delay, in full co-operation with the United Nations, the unhindered provision at scale by all concerned of urgently needed basic services and humanitarian assistance, including food, water, electricity, fuel, shelter, clothing, hygiene and sanitation requirements, as well as medical supplies and medical care to Palestinians throughout Gaza".

incidentsData.title: 6 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli gunfire and shelling hit people waiting for aid in Shuja'iyya, Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 7 wounded
incidentsData.description: In the first of two incidents on the same day, Israeli troops fired on people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 12 killed, 30 wounded
incidentsData.description: In a second incident, Israeli troops fired on people securing an aid convoy and waiting crowds near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City. Sources report at least 12 people killed.
incidentsData.sources:
ACLED
Wafa
Al Jazeera
Al Jazeera

incidentsData.title: World Central Kitchen killings
incidentsData.description: Israeli drones strikes targeted a three-car convoy from the World Central Kitchen, killing seven aid workers. Six of those killed were from Western countries, and one was Palestinian. International condemnation over the killings put pressure on Israel to faciliate aid deliveries and to do more to protect aid workers and people recieving aid.

incidentsData.title: 4 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops fired on people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops fired on people waiting for aid west of Beit Lahia. Multiple people wounded, according to sources. We recorded two.
incidentsData.sources:
ACLED
Al Jazeera
Anas Al-Sharif
Safa

incidentsData.title: Erez West/Zikim crossing in northern Gaza opens
incidentsData.description: Israel allows a humanitarian convoy to enter Gaza through the northern Erez West/Zikim border crossing for the first time since the beginning of the war. The opening of the crossing is officially announced on 12 May. However, Israeli authorities only allow small amounts of aid to enter, and aid groups aren't able to transport supplies entering through the north to the south of Gaza, where the majority of the enclave's population has been displaced.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on an aid convoy shortly after it entered northern Gaza, killing a driver. Artillery hit the area shortly after. In addition to the driver who was killed, sources say a number of people were wounded. We recorded two.
incidentsData.sources:
ACLED
NewPress
Quds
Quds
Quds

incidentsData.title: Invasion of Rafah
incidentsData.description: Israel launches a full-scale ground invasion of Rafah, the southernmost city in Gaza. Rafah had become a refuge for over 1 million Palestinians displaced from other parts of Gaza. The city was also the logistics and operations hub for international aid organisations. During the invasion, Israel seized control of the Rafah border crossing, one of the main entry points for aid, forcing it to close. The Kerem Shalom crossing technically remained open, according to Israel, but aid groups said military operations in the vicinity of the crossing made it impossible to transport and distribute supplies.

incidentsData.title: US floating aid pier begins operating
incidentsData.description: The first aid delivery to Gaza via the US-built floating aid pier is completed. The pier is heavily criticised as a costly and ineffective distraction that won't address widespread hunger in Gaza.

incidentsData.title: No casulaties reported
incidentsData.description: Israeli helicopters fire on people waiting for aid near the beach in northern Gaza, shortly after the American aid pier opened. No casualties were reported.

incidentsData.title: No casulaties reported
incidentsData.description: Israeli artillery fire lands near people waiting for aid deliveries near the new American aid pier. No casualties were reported.

incidentsData.title: 15 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hits a warehouse used for food aid, killing at least 15 people outside, including women and children.

incidentsData.title: The International Court of Justice issues a third set of provisional measures
incidentsData.description: The ICJ orders Israel to halt the Rafah offensive and open the Rafah crossing to allow entry of aid. The court notes previous orders that required the "unhindered provision at scale by all concerned of urgently needed basic services and humanitarian assistance".

incidentsData.title: 9 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli artillery fire hits people waiting for aid on Salah al-Din Street in Rafah. Sources say at least nine people were killed.

incidentsData.title: 8 killed, 12 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hits people securing aid delivery at an UNRWA building used to distribute aid, killing at least eight people and injuring 12. Aid committee members and other civilians waiting to receive aid were among those killed and injured.

incidentsData.title: 10 killed, 22 injured
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hits people securing aid delivery and people waiting for aid. Sources vary on the number of wounded, from unreported to up to 22. We recorded 22 wounded.
incidentsData.sources:
ACLED
Reuters
Wafa
Quds
Al Ghad

incidentsData.title: 3 killed, 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike near food distribution centre kills civilian aid committee members and people waiting for aid. Sources report several wounded. We recorded three.

incidentsData.title: 10 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli fire, likely from artillery, killed people collecting water near a mosque in Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hits people waiting for aid near Khan Younis.

incidentsData.title: US floating aid pier shut down
incidentsData.description: After just two tricky months of use, the US officially shut down the aid pier on 17 July. It ended up delivering the equivalent of one day's worth of food at a cost of $230 million.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hits a bakery in Deir al-Balah.
incidentsData.sources:
ACLED
NewPress
https://t.me/hamza20300/271733
https://t.me/hamza20300/271739
https://t.me/hamza20300/271738

incidentsData.title: 1 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike injured at least one person collecting water near a mosque in Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 8 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike killed civilians waiting for bread at a stand outside an UNRWA shelter in Jabalia. Sources report eight killed and others wounded. We recorded two wounded.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people outside a bakery in Gaza City. Sources report three killed and others wounded. We recorded two wounded.

incidentsData.title: 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people outside a bakery in Gaza City. Sources report between one and four people wounded. We recorded three.

incidentsData.title: 6 killed, 24 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people outside a bakery in al-Mawasi, which Israeli authorities had declared a "humanitarian zone", killing at least six, including two children. Reports say dozens of others were injured. The Israeli military said they were targeting a senior Islamic Jihad militant.

incidentsData.title: First total siege of Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun
incidentsData.description: Israel begins blocking the entry of all aid into the northernmost areas of Gaza ahead of a major military operation. The total siege last from 2 October to 7 November

incidentsData.title: 3 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a water tanker and people collecting water in Jabalia. Sources estimate three killed.

incidentsData.title: Israeli military launches major operation in Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun
incidentsData.description: The siege and assault appear to match the description and objectives of the "General's Plan", a strategy proposed by a group of retired military officers who advocated laying siege to the north to force those who remained, whether civilians or militants, to "surrender or starve".

incidentsData.title: 8 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit people collecting water in Rafah. Sources do not specify the number of people injured. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 10 killed, 40 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit an UNRWA centre as civilians waited for aid distribution. Sources report at least 40 wounded.

incidentsData.title: 6 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: An Israeli airstrike hit people collecting water in Jabalia. Sources say six killed and others wounded. We recorded two wounded.
incidentsData.sources:
OCHA
Wafa
Al Jazeera
ACLED

incidentsData.title: 11 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Two Israeli airstrikes in rapid succession hit a vehicle near a mosque where aid was being distributed, killing civilian aid committee volunteers and people waiting for assistance.
incidentsData.sources:
Anadolu
AlarabyTV
Al Haq
Quds
Al Jazeera
Al Hadath

incidentsData.title: 6 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces, reportedly tanks, hit a group of people waiting for aid near a mosque in Gaza City. The same mosque was targeted on 25 October. Sources vary on the number of wounded, from unspecified to dozens. We recorded two.
incidentsData.sources:
PCHR
New Press
Al Jazeera
https://t.me/QudsN/487620
Quds
ACLED

incidentsData.title: First aid delivery to North Gaza since 2 October
incidentsData.description: WFP is able dispatch a convoy to North Gaza with food for the first time in over a month. The goods are offloaded by desperate people before they reach their destination.

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli fire, reportedly from tanks, hit people collecting water in Jabalia. Reports say several wounded. We recorded three.

incidentsData.title: 5 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: An Israeli strike, likely either drone or tank fire, hit a group of people near an aid warehouse. Reports say five killed and others wounded. We recorded two wounded.
incidentsData.sources:
Al Haq
Al Mayadeen
ACLED

incidentsData.title: Second aid delivery to North Gaza since 2 October
incidentsData.description: WFP delivers two trucks of food and water to an UNRWA shelter in Beit Hanoun. It had planned to deliver 14, but Israeli authorisation delays and other challenges led to its reduction in size.

incidentsData.title: No reported casualties
incidentsData.description: Israeli artillery shelling or airstrikes hit the area around an UNRWA shelter shortly after a World Food Programme convoy delivered aid. On 12 November, Israeli troops surrounded the shelter, forced people to leave, and then set the shelter on fire. There were no reported casualties from the initial strikes. However, two people were reportedly killed and others wounded during the forced evacuation.
incidentsData.sources:
OCHA
WFP
Quds
Quds
Al Haq
Al Araby
Anadolu
Wafa
Sanad
Al Jazeera

incidentsData.title: 12 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli shelling hit a residential building near where civilians waited for aid to arrive, leaving at least 14 casualties. This incident happened the day after a successful World Food Programme delivery, and on the same day as another attempted aid delivery in the same area. Reports do not specify the number of wounded. We recorded two.
incidentsData.sources:
Wafa
OCHA
Al Jazeera
Al Araby
Anadolu

incidentsData.title: Second total siege of Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun
incidentsData.description: Israel again blocks all UN aid from entering the northern most areas of Gaza from 12 November to 20 December 2024 as major military operation continues.

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops fired on people collecting water outside Kamal Odwan Hospital. Sources do not specify the number of wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 4 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike targeted a soup kitchen in Nuseirat, killing at least two. Quadcopter drones and artillery targeted the same area hours later. A house next to the soup kitchen was destroyed in another airstrike two days later.

incidentsData.title: 5 killed, 15 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people waiting in front of a soup kitchen and bakery. Most of the casualties were children. Some sources say more than 15 wounded. We recorded 15.

incidentsData.title: 4 killed, 10 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit people carrying aid packages which they had just picked up.
incidentsData.sources:
Al Jazeera
https://t.me/saedalzaneen8/137873
https://t.me/safaps/269821
https://t.me/safaps/269781
https://t.me/safaps/269792

incidentsData.title: 9 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people waiting for food packages outside an aid warehouse; casualties included four children and one woman. The same immediate area was hit by an airstrike on 1 January, without reported casualties.
incidentsData.sources:
Wafa
Alaraby
Al Jazeera
https://t.me/hamza20300/323005
ACLED
https://t.me/asmailpress/217324
https://t.me/muhamadalsharif/419946

incidentsData.title: 6 killed, 10 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a soup kitchen inside the Israeli-declared humanitarian safe zone in al-Mawasi. Early reports say four wounded, and later reports say 10. We recorded 10.

incidentsData.title: Ceasefire begins
incidentsData.description: After 470 days of brutal Israeli military assualt and siege, Israel and Hamas agree to a three-phase ceasefire deal. Although, whether the deal will lead to a permanent end to the war is highly uncertain. We recorded no attacks on people seeking aid during the ceasefire. However, we did record several attacks on local police guarding aid convoys during this period.

incidentsData.title: Israel imposes total siege on Gaza
incidentsData.description: Israel closes all crossings into Gaza, blocking humanitarian aid and commercial goods. The siege is announced just after the beginning of the Muslim holy month of Ramadan. Previously, an average of 600 trucks had been entering Gaza per day during the ceasefire.

incidentsData.title: Israel withdraws from ceasefire
incidentsData.description: The Israeli military launches a massive wave of airstrikes across Gaza, killing over 400 Palestinians, ending the ceasefire that last for nearly two months. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warns that the airstrikes are "only the beginning".

incidentsData.title: 5 killed, 6 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a soup kitchen as civilians waited for food, killing one volunteer with World Central Kitchen, which supplied the soup kitchen. Most of the casualties were children. Some sources report 15 or more wounded. World Central Kitchen confirmed six wounded to The New Humanitarian via email.
incidentsData.sources:
OCHA

Al Jazeera
Anadolu
Al Ghad

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a soup kitchen in Gaza City. Sources report several wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 4 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a World Central Kitchen soup kitchen in Gaza City, injuring at least two WCK staffers and people waiting for food. At the same time, another airstrike hit a home next to a WCK site in Deir al-Balah, killing three; the same site was hit again on 2 April. It's unclear if the latter strikes were related.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit a soup kitchen in al-Mawasi. Israeli authorities had previously described the area as a "safe zone" or "humanitarian zone", but removed that designation after the end of the ceasefire in March 2025.
incidentsData.sources:

incidentsData.title: 10 killed, 25 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit a soup kitchen in al-Mawasi, leaving at least 35 casualties including two children. Early sources report seven killed, but later sources note that three more died in hospital on 8 April.

incidentsData.title: 1 wounded
incidentsData.description: After an Israeli miltiary warning, two strikes hit Bani Suhaila; one destroyed an UNRWA-run flour distribution point and a reported 70 to 100 tents housing displaced people.

UN News
Al Jazeera

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 1 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli strike hit a bakery, killing a couple and wounding their young daughter.

incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit a soup kitchen, killing a cook.

incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit a soup kitchen, killing three from the same family, including a child.

incidentsData.title: WFP runs out of food
incidentsData.description: The World Food Programme announces that it has run out of food stocks in Gaza. Already, all 25 WFP-supported bakeries shut down at the end of March because wheat flour and fuel ran out due to the total Israeli siege.

incidentsData.title: 4 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit civilians carrying flour back to a shelter, injuring four including one child.
incidentsData.sources:
YouTube

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 6 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit a soup kitchen, killing at least one child. Most other casualties were children. Some sources say one killed, but others name two people who died. We recorded two killed.
incidentsData.sources:
YouTube
Nabd

incidentsData.title: 6 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit a soup kitchen. Sources don't specify the number wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 8 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit a soup kitchen. Neighbourhood Telegram groups and social media sources mention that the target was a soup kitchen, a detail not included in news reports.

incidentsData.title: World Central Kitchen runs out of food
incidentsData.description: The NGO WCK, a major supplier of food in Gaza, announces that it has run out of supplies to cook meals and bake bread.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a soup kitchen in a tent.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit a soup kitchen on the roof of a home. Several reported wounded. We recorded three.

incidentsData.title: 2 killed
incidentsData.description: Bomb dropped from Israeli quadcopter drone killed two carrying bags of flour.

incidentsData.title: Israel allows limited aid supplies to enter Gaza
incidentsData.description: For the first time since 2 March, Israel agrees to allow some aid to enter Gaza. The number of trucks is limited, and the aid is only allowed into the south. In the following days, a handful of bakeries temporarily begin operating again, but many aid trucks are looted by desperate people.

incidentsData.title: 10 killed, 60 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike or drone strike hit a bakery. Sources vary on the number of wounded, but reliable sources and video evidence suggest at least 60 wounded. We recorded 10 killed and 60 wounded.

incidentsData.title: 2 killed
incidentsData.description: One of three Israeli strikes within 10 minutes in Khan Younis hit a bakery, killing two.

incidentsData.title: 10 killed, 5 wounded
incidentsData.description: A series of Israeli airstrikes targeting civilian aid committee members escorting an aid convoy killed volunteers and bystanders. Sources report 10 killed and a large number wounded. We recorded five wounded.

incidentsData.title: Gaza Humanitarian Foundation begins operating
incidentsData.description: From the beginning, food distribution at GHF sites are marked by chaos and violence. Before it started operating, the UN and numerous international NGOs warned that the GHF's militarised food distribution model was dangerous, likely violated international law, and served Israel's military and political interests.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 1 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a soup kitchen.

incidentsData.title: 7 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people outside a bakery in Gaza City. Sources don't specify the number of wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: No reported casualties
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit an aid warehouse in Gaza City. Casualties unknown.

incidentsData.title: 8 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airplanes and a drone fired on people waiting for aid trucks at the Nabulsi Roundabout. Sources suggest one killed, but we were not able to verify.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 4 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a soup kitchen, killing one and wounding at least four, including children.

incidentsData.title: 1 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airplanes and a drone again fired on people waiting for aid trucks at the Nabulsi Roundabout.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a bakery in a tent in al-Mawasi. Sources report several wounded. We recorded three.

incidentsData.title: 5 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli planes targeted people in al-Sudaniya as they waited for aid from the Zikim border crossing. Sources reported "other" wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces targeted people waiting for aid at the Nabulsi Roundabout. Sources do not specify the number wounded, refering to "others" and "tens". We recorded three wounded.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli planes targeted people in al-Sudaniya as they waited for aid from the Zikim border crossing. Sources do not specify number of wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed, 10 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces targeted people waiting for aid at the Nabulsi Roundabout.

incidentsData.title: 12 killed, 50 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli ships and artillery fired on people in al-Sudaniya as they waited for aid from the Zikim border crossing.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli ships fired on people waiting for aid near the Nabulsi Roundabout. Sources reported either three or four people killed. We recorded three.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops fired on people waiting for aid west of Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people waiting for aid in al-Shati Camp.

incidentsData.title: 4 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli planes targeted people in al-Sudaniya as they waited for aid from the Zikim border crossing.

incidentsData.title: 5 killed, 12 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli troops fired on people waiting for aid in al-Shati Camp. Sources report a dozen wounded. We recorded 12.

incidentsData.title: 5 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid near Beit Lahia. Sources don't specify number of wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people waiting for aid on Salah al-Din street in Gaza City. Sources don't specify number of wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 6 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people waiting for aid in al-Shati Camp. Sources don't specify the number of wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 9 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid on al-Rashid Street near Beit Lahia. Some sources say more than 25 wounded. Others do not specify. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 10 killed, 15 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid near Beit Lahia. Early sources say five killed. Later sources suggest as many as 10 bodies being brought to hospital. We recorded 10 killed because it was unclear whether reports of bodies being brought were in addition to or inclusive of initial five reported killed.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people waiting for aid in al-Shati Camp. Sources don't specify the number of wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 18 killed, 22 wounded
incidentsData.description: At least 40 casualties after Israeli airstrike hit a warehouse where, reportedly, civil police and local families were selling flour at standard prices after confiscating it from commercial traders who were selling it at inflated prices.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces, including troops and artillery or naval ships, fired on civilians waiting for aid trucks from the Zikim crossing, including TNH contributor Hani Qarmoot. At least three killed, including a boy of about 10 years old.

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 5 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a bakery, leaving at least seven casualties. Sources report "others" and "dozens" injured. Video evidence suggests at least five wounded. We recorded five.

incidentsData.title: 13 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid in Gaza City. Sources don't specify the number wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 7 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid at the Nabulsi Roundabout. Sources don't specify the number wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 11 killed, 65 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces targeted people waiting for aid southwest of Gaza City. Sources say that more than 65 were injured.

incidentsData.title: 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Two people waiting for aid injured by quadcopter bombs in two incidents at the Nabulsi Roundabout and near the Wadi Gaza bridge.

incidentsData.title: 16 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli tanks and snipers fired at aid trucks and civilians trying to collect flour, killing at least 16 including a former MSF employee, Abdullah Hammad.

incidentsData.title: 6 killed, 100 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid at the Nabulsi Roundabout. Reports say more than 100 wounded.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed, 15 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people collecting water at a desalination plant west of Gaza City. Reports say about 15 wounded.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed, 3 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike or artillery hit a soup kitchen in Deir al-Balah. Sources say several wounded. We recorded three.

incidentsData.title: 15 killed, 30 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit queue of people waiting for nutritional supplements outside an aid centre operated by a UNICEF partner, killing 15, including 10 children. Later reporting suggests death toll my be as high as 17 with over 30 wounded.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid from Zikim crossing, in Sudaniya, near Beit Lahia. Sources don't specify the number wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 2 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people waiting for aid west of Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 11 killed, 40 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike or drone hit people collecting water at a water truck. Many of the casualties were children. Sources report over 40 wounded.

incidentsData.title: 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a soup kitchen, injuring two. The Israeli military issued a warning before the strike. Sources say people injured. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 11 killed, 15 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike killed 11 people, including seven children, lined up at a water distribution point. The Israeli military said the strike targeted an Islamic Jihad militant, but a technical malfunction caused the strike to hit "dozens of metres away from the intended target".

incidentsData.title: 1 killed, 4 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit a water tanker, killing the driver and people collecting water.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid in al-Shati camp.

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 24 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli tanks fired on people waiting for aid in al-Shati camp. Sources report dozens wounded. We recorded 24.

incidentsData.title: 58 killed, 60 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid in al-Shati camp.

incidentsData.title: 81 killed, 150 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli tanks, snipers, and ground troops opened fire on people who had gathered around a World Food Programme convoy which entered Gaza from the Zikim crossing. Palestinian Civil Defence in Gaza reported that an Israeli military bulldozer buried dozens of casualties in the sand. Sources say number of wounder over 150.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli tanks fired on people waiting for aid in al-Shati Camp. Sources report either three or four people killed, and possibly others wounded. We recorded three killed.

incidentsData.title: 2 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on civilians waiting for aid in Gaza City. Sources don't specify number of wounded. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 5 killed, 2 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli airstrike hit people collecting water, killing five. Sources don't specify number of injured. We recorded two.

incidentsData.title: 4 killed, 14 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on civilians waiting for aid near the Nabulsi Roundabout in Gaza City killing four and injuring at least 14.

incidentsData.title: 8 killed, 118 injured
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid near the Nabulsi Roundabout in Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 1 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid near the Nabulsi Roundabout in Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 29 killed
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on civilians, waiting for aid entering from Zikim crossing, in the Sudaniya neighbourhood near Beit Lahia. Some sources report at least 12 killed, but multiple reliable sources report 29 killed. We recorded 29.

incidentsData.title: 5 killed, 58 injured
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on civilians, waiting for aid from Zikim crossing, in Sudaniya, near Beit Lahia.

incidentsData.title: 9 killed, 24 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on civilians, waiting for aid from Zikim crossing, in Sudaniya, near Beit Lahia. Sources mention dozens wounded. We recorded 24.

incidentsData.title: 20 killed, 300 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on civilians, waiting for aid from Zikim crossing, in Sudaniya, near Beit Lahia. Sources say at least 300 wounded.

incidentsData.title: 16 killed, 300 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid from Zikim crossing in Sudaniya, near Beit Lahia, killing or wounding at least 316 people in the first of two incidents in the area on 26 July.

incidentsData.title: 11 killed, 120 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces again fired on people waiting for aid in Sudaniya, near Beit Lahia, killing 11 and wounding at least 120.

incidentsData.title: 7 killed, 12 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid in Sudaniya, near Beit Lahia. Various sources report 12 to 20 people wounded. We recorded 12.

incidentsData.title: 70 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid near the Nabulsi Roundabout in Gaza City. The Palestine Red Crescent reported treating 70 wounded in the incident.

incidentsData.title: 10 killed, 25 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid from Zikim crossing, in Sudaniya, near Beit Lahia. Casualties included children and people tasked with securing aid deliveries. Sources initially report five killed and 30 wounded. Later sources report five additional deaths. We recorded 10 deaths and 25 wounded.

incidentsData.title: 3 killed, 29 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on civilians waiting for aid near the Nabulsi Roundabout in Gaza City. The Palestine Red Crescent reported 3 killed and 29 wounded.

incidentsData.title: 8 killed, 126 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid from Zikim crossing, in Sudaniya, near Beit Lahia. The attack lasted several hours and left at least 134 casualties.

incidentsData.title: 60 killed, 700 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid from the Zikim crossing, in Sudaniya, near Beit Lahia, leaving at least 760 casualties.

incidentsData.title: 7 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli drone strike hit people collecting water in al-Mawasi.

incidentsData.title: 8 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid near the Nabulsi Roundabout in Gaza City.

incidentsData.title: 4 killed, 75 wounded
incidentsData.description: Israeli forces fired on people waiting for aid from the Zikim crossing, in Sudaniya, near Beit Lahia, leaving at least 79 casualties.
